author: The Times News
title: Business | thetimesnews.com
text:
LIBERTY — The Norcraft Companies cabinetry plant in Liberty is one of two North Carolina plants being closed in 2025 by parent company MasterBrand Cabinets.
[
Haand Inc. founders Pence and Warren evolve the business of pottery and ceramics by focusing on integrity of human touch](/features/haand-inc-founders-pence-and-warren-evolve-the-business-of-pottery-and-ceramics-by-focusing/article_67912ca3-8c7c-54ac-aa69-bd88a790f405.html)
Chris Pence and Mark Warren aspire to revolutionize the pottery and ceramics industry from cookie-cutter mass production. Their goal is for each one of their pieces to maintain the humanity of the artisan who created it.
On June 3, 2022, a young mother’s dream of owning a small business came true with the delivery of a 150-square-foot gray shed that would serve as her tiny storefront.
BURLINGTON — To show appreciation and support to U.S. military personnel on Veterans Day, Autobell Car Wash will offer all veterans and active-duty service members a free Ride-Thru Exterior wash, or an equivalent credit toward another wash op…
[
Times-News Entrepreneur of the Week: Newins and Make Nice LLC enjoy business-friendly atmosphere of Alamance County](/features/times-news-entrepreneur-of-the-week-newins-and-make-nice-llc-enjoy-business-friendly-atmosphere/article_2c586904-da0e-51f8-a1ab-ef7aba22a4f2.html)
Mike Newins understands the ups and downs of being a small business owner. He has learned the hard lesson that even during the slow periods, he can’t afford to take a day off.
After edging up during the summer, Alamance County’s jobless rate reversed in September.
BURLINGTON — NCWorks Career Center of Alamance County, 2640 Columbine Lane, Burlington, will hold a job fair on Wednesday, Nov. 6, from 1:30-3:30 p.m.
